frame.name: Proportional_quantity
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Denoted_quantity</fen> is (generally) an imprecise characterization of the quantity of <fen>Individuals</fen> or a <fen>Mass</fen>, made with reference to a relatively easily and precisely imaginable <fen>Reference_quantity</fen>.
<ex>It took <t><fex name="Denoted_quantity">about</fex></t> <fex name="Reference_quantity">three</fex> <fex name="Individuals">hours</fex>, but we 're done now.</ex> <ex>But there were <t><fex name="Denoted_quantity">barely</fex></t> <fex name="Reference_quantity">300</fex> in the whole district. <fex name="Individuals">DNI</fex></ex> <ex>Put in right <fex name="Denoted_quantity"><t>around</t></fex> <fex name="Reference_quantity">a pinch and a half</fex>. <fex name="Mass">DNI</fex> </ex> <ex>She waited <t><fex name="Denoted_quantity">a good</fex></t> <fex name="Individuals">second</fex> before knocking.</ex> <ex>She waited <t>a good</t> <fex name="Reference_quantity">second</fex> before knocking.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Denoted_quantity
FE.definition: <def-root>The quantity denoted by phrases headed by the Target. </def-root>

FE.name: Individuals
FE.definition: <def-root>A collection of entities, either quantifiable physical beings (e.g. <m>toads</m>) or quantifiable units whether physical or not (e.g. <m>dollars</m>). </def-root>

FE.name: Reference_quantity
FE.definition: <def-root>A relatively precise quantity in some oft-used form that is used as the basis for defining the <fen>Denoted_quantity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>
